idiom.meaning: Living up to one's name or reputation
idiom.example: The restaurant truly lives up to its reputation as the best in town.

shortDescription: This idiom originates from the Han Dynasty text 'Hou Han Shu' (后汉书), where it described officials whose abilities matched their titles.
